1. "The Twilight Saga: New Moon" (2009) | Plot Keywords: what, zero |
This movie follows the story of Bella Swann (Taylor Lautner), a young woman who moves to Forks High School with her boyfriend Edward Cullen (Robert Pattinson). However, when Edward discovers that Bella has not told her about her own secret love for Jacob Black (Lea Salonga)), Edward leaves Bella behind and moves back to his old home in Italy. However, as time goes on, Edward begins to realize just how much he really loves Bella. And so, as Edward begins to come to terms with the true extent of his feelings for Bella, he begins to make plans to spend more time with Bella and to get Bella to fall in love with him as well.
Overall, this movie is a great choice for those who enjoy romantic comedies that are full of twists, turns, and surprises along the way.

2. "Aladdin" (1992) | Plot Keywords: what, zero |
This movie follows the story of Aladdin (Scott Weinger), a young man who lives in a small town on the outskirts of an even smaller town. However, when Aladdin discovers that he really doesn't have much money to his name and that he also doesn't have any good friends or family members to turn to for help if he were ever to fall into trouble like this, he begins to make plans to steal some money from one of the rich merchants in the town, and to use some of that stolen money to buy himself some new clothes and some fancy decorations for his new house that he plans on building using some of the remaining stolen money.
Overall, this movie is a great choice for those who enjoy romantic comedies that are full of twists, turns, and surprises along the way.

Ultimately, both "The Twilight Saga: New Moon" (2009) and "Aladdin" (1992) are fantastic choices for those who enjoy romantic comedies.
